Game

Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Game.GameModel

  • public class GameModel
extends java.util.Observable
    Class which is part of the MVC model. Holds all information related to the current game being played. Stores the array of players as well as being called by the GameGUI when player-pet interactions occur.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameModel()
      Constructor which only creates an empty list for storing players.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameModel

        public GameModel()
        Constructor which only creates an empty list for storing players. One the player set up has finished in the GameGUI, players will be added to the 'players' ArrayList.

    • Method Detail

      • setDays

        public void setDays(int daysInput)
        Sets the number of days, value is obtained after game set up has finished from GameGUI.
        Parameters:
        daysInput - Number of days the game will be played for.

      • getDays

        public int getDays()
        Getter which returns the number of days.
        Returns:
        The number of days the game will be played for.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
        Getter which returns the ArrayList of players.
        Returns:
        Returns the ArrayList of players playing the game.

      • getPlayerPets

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pets> getPlayerPets(Player player)
        Getter which returns the ArrayList of pets belong to a given player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player which the pets belong to.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of pets which the player owns..

      • getPlayerName

        public java.lang.String getPlayerName(Player player)
        Getter for obtaining the player's name.
        Parameters:
        player - Player whose name we want.
        Returns:
        The player's name.

      • addPlayers

        public void addPlayers(java.lang.String[] names)
        Creates and adds Players with an empty pet array. Pets will be added later after the pet set up finishes in the GameGUI.
        Parameters:
        names - The names of the players who are going to play the game.

      • endDayForPlayer

        public void endDayForPlayer(Player player)
        Ends the day for the player, resetting each pet's action. Each pet will also be subjected to a possibility of a random event occurring.
        Parameters:
        player - Player whose pet's actions will be reset/try for random events.

      • healPet

        public java.lang.String healPet(Player player,
                                Pets pet,
                                Item med)
        Method to heal the pet using a medicinal item.
        Parameters:
        player - Player who's inventory to use the item from.
        pet - Pet to heal
        med - Medicine item to use.
        Returns:
        A message that informs the user of what has happened.

      • revivePet

        public java.lang.String revivePet(Pets pet)
        Method to (try to) revive a dead pet. Note: A pet can only be revived once.
        Parameters:
        pet - Pet to attempt to revive.
        Returns:
        A message that informs the user of what has happened, and if the pet was able to be revived.

      • getMedItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> getMedItems(Player player)
        Method which displays all medicine items in the player's inventory.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose inventory is being searched.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of medical items found in the player's inventory.

      • takeToToilet

        public java.lang.String takeToToilet(Player player,
                                     Pets pet)
        Player lets a pet use the bathroom.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who owns the pet.
        pet - The pet let out to use the toilet.
        Returns:
        A message to inform the player of what has happened.

      • playWithPet

        public java.lang.String playWithPet(Player player,
                                    Pets pet,
                                    Item toy)
        The player plays with a pet using a toy.
        Parameters:
        player - The player which plays with their pet.
        pet - The pet which plays with the toy
        toy - The toy which will be used.
        Returns:
        A message to inform the player of what has happened.

      • getToyItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> getToyItems(Player player)
        Getter which returns all the toys from the players inventory.
        Parameters:
        player - Player whose inventory will be searched.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of toys belonging to the player.

      • putPetToSleep

        public java.lang.String putPetToSleep(Player player,
                                      Pets pet)
        Player puts a pet to sleep.
        Parameters:
        player - Player whose pet will be put to sleep (not the dead kind of sleeping).
        pet - The pet who will be put to sleep.
        Returns:
        A message that will inform the player of what has happened.

      • getFoodItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> getFoodItems(Player player)
        Shows all the food items in the player's inventory.
        Parameters:
        player - Player whose inventory will be searched for food items.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of food items the player owns.

      • feedPet

        public java.lang.String feedPet(Player player,
                                Pets pet,
                                Item food)
        Method for a player will feed a pet.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that will feed a pet.
        pet - Pet that will be fed.
        food - The food item that will be fed to the pet.
        Returns:
        The message that will inform the user of what has happened.

      • calculateScore

        public void calculateScore()
        Calculate the score for each player. Score is calculated by multiplying each of the pet's stats by a multiplier then adding it to the player's score. Penalties are given if the pet has died/is dead/is sick/is misbehaving.
